Comment: Huh. That's... perhaps less surprising than one would think. Part of the right-wing playbook is heavy use of uncertainty. If you can make someone less than certain that you'll take a particular action, you can make doing that action a little more likely to be successful, since that uncertainty can delay opponents' maneuvers to defeat your planned action.   It's similar logic to the "token black guy", where nearly all of a white person's friends are white, except for one black person whom the white person trots out to display how said white person isn't a racist.  "See? We can play nice about abortion stuff, really! Just trust us, bros!!1!"
Author: takingastep

Comment: I tend to believe that this may be a first serious political calculation coming out of Donny's little brain since "build the wall". He apparently understands that anything other than "absolutely nothing" that his administration does with regard to abortion means near certain defeat for GOPs in the the coming midterms. So, he'll want to appear to be measured and moderate for now... and will save the pitchforks and torches till after the midterms.
